Cell.Data: Q5: What is the purpose of the light near the webcam? If you do not know, please mention "I don't know" in the text box below.
Q:22 Do you think it would be possible for a hacker to spy on you through your webcam?
Q11: Have you ever noticed the webcam light come on at a time when you were not using your webcam?
Q12: Yes :Have you ever noticed the webcam light come on at a time when you were not using your webcam (for example, when you were not video chatting, recording video, or anything like that)?
To illuminate my face or whatever I am taking a video of in-case the lighting is poor in the room I'm in
My webcam is an external one. I have it sit atop my laptop screen when I am using. When I am done using it, I disconnect it and put it away because it sits so awkwardly atop my monitor on my laptop
To notify that it is working.
i think it is not possible hacker spy on my webcam because my webcam usage is very low
I think it adjusts the lighting
I had installed good antivirus software.It protects unwanted sites.
It tells me if the webcam is on.
There is a very small chance I would be spied on since I am not rich, am a 33 year old man and I use a Mac.
I doubt a hacker could wireless access my cam and turn it on.
To give better lighting to your picture/video.
according to my knowledge i think it is not possible to hack the web camera in my computer
to tell me that the webcam is on or in use
I always unplug my webcam when I am not using it.
My webcam has a power switch on it.
THE PURPOSE OF THE LIGHT NEAR THE WEBCAM IS TO SHOW THE PERSON IN THIS SIDE TO THE PERSON CHATTING OTHER SIDE.
They would have to turn on my cam without me noticing
To give better lighting for the subject.
I don't think they can get access to it.
To show that the webcam is in use.
because it is in my home and the PC and webcam is on my personal room
I am not sure how they would do it, so I do not believe it would happen to me.
to show that the webcam is on
Because I keep my webcam disabled when I do not need to use it. I also have a small piece of paper covering my webcam just to be safe.
To indicate whether the cam is on or not
I usually cover the lens to avoid the bright LED's shining into my eyes. Only while using the webcam, I remove the cover.
I think it just indicates when it's turned on...?
I run full system security scans very frequently and never share access rights to anybody besides myself.
It indicates when the camera is on and working.
because i don't think hackers can have access to my computer
It turned on when my laptop was infected with spyware.
to show when it is on and being used
It is to provide additional light so I am more visible when I am using the webcam
I'm using a Mac, and I'm very careful when it comes to install apps and plugins.
It indicates the webcam is on
Unless they were able to turn the light off, I would know, and I don't see that as a likelyhood.
I believe that I have my security settings adjusted so they don't allow unknown access.
No because my webcam only comes online when I use and it's not connected to specific server that can be hacked.
i do not think he can access the hardware
I don't think it's possible. It would take too much work and I always unplug my webcam when not in usage.
I think when Im booting up the computer it comes on
To illuminate the face, since the picture quality from the webcam tends to be dark. or it means its turned on.
I have antivirus protection on my computer, so I do not think someone could spy on me.
To indicate the webcam is on.
To let me know the webcam is on
I think its to make it easier to see the images on your screen that the webcam is recording.
As soon as I notice that the webcam is on without my prior permission, I would take immediate action to counter and block off the intrusion.
You have to have a password and be connected to the wecam.
It tells me when it is on.

All operating systems have vulnerabilties. I am sure if a hacker really wanted to access my webcam it would be difficult to stop them. However, all I have to do is cover the camera with electrical tape and it would then be impossible for the hacker to receive any useful webcam video.
Because I take the necessary precautions to prevent someone from spying on my webcam. I am careful on which sites I go to and I have a good anti virus program
I keep the lens of my camera covered when I'm not using it.
Not connected to internet and I am not that important to get hacked
TO MAKE USER AWARE THAT WEBCAM IS ON
Me personally, no as I take great care to avoid perceived threats.
To indicate when the camera is on
Because I do have firewall and K7 anti-virus. Think that will restrict all the spy action.
To let me know that the webcam is on.
Because I am very computer savvy and have multiple virus/malware scans and scan my computer daily.
i just dont see how anyone can
My webcam is external and attaches by USB and I only attach it when I'm using it and remove it right after.
the light near the webcam not enough in brightness that time use light for the purpose
Our home network is very secure.
To tell the user the webcam is on
I unplug it when not in use.
It is there to let me know the webcam is currently on and in operation.
To indicate if it is active or not
I know enough about computers to not let myself be hacked or have a RAT program installed on my computer unknowingly.
To let me know that it is running, or to take a picture.
I would have found some evidence by now of a rouge process stealing bandwidth, storing files. I would blame anti spyware anti virus for not alerting me sooner.
to let you know the web cam is operating
I know a lot about computers and hardware.
To show that the webcam is on.

There is a remote possibility but I answered "no" to this because I always have up to date anti-virus software on my PC and my webcam is only plugged in whenever I intend on using it. There's no way a hacker could spy on me when the cam is unplugged and completely detached from the PC. I've never owned a laptop, only desktop computers.
My webcam is disabled in my computer.
To know if the camera in on
I believe the light is hardwired to the webcam so it will turn on whenever the cam is on, and there is no way to make it so the light doesn't turn on when the webcam is on.
I believe it's built into the laptop to have the light on immediately when the webcam is in use. I also believe that remotely, it would be hard for someone to turn your webcam on.
I personally have never heard of it happening.
To let you know the cam is on.
I'm running OS X and am very selective about which programs I install.
I have a separate webcam that I keep unplugged, and the one built in to my laptop has a paper taped across it so it can never be used.
To show that the webcam is on.
If I saw my webcam turn on, I would simply turn it off and try to figure out why it happened before any 'spying' could occur.
To let me know when the webcam is on
I don't know - maybe a flash?
I am behind double firewalls and have my internet security up to date blocking incoming connections to the webcam. As well as when I am not using the webcam I place a piece of tape over it.
I take a good amount of precautions, as I am a bit savvy in the use of encryption software and security measures. I also regularly block it's lens when I'm not using it.
There is security in place on the laptop to prevent that from happening
To let me know if the camera is on.
I think to tell me if its on
To notify you that it is on
I am very careful which websites I visit and what type of information I share. I regularly update anti spyware and delete cookies and cache on my computers.
The light is for giving quality video.

I've never really thought about it... It's not something I've heard about, so if it's been happening a lot lately I've completely missed it. I always connected hackers more with stealing information and ruining things, rather than stalking behavior.
To notify the user when the webcam is active.
I don't know if this is possible or not
To let you know when the webcam is on.
It's to confirm when the webcam is filming or broadcasting.
I have my indication light covered with black tape because it gets on my nerves. I guess someone else could activate it without me realizing it. I'm not sure hackers have that ability, though.
Well why would they and what would they gain?
As far as I know, the light indicates when the webcam is on.
I have no idea. I really hope not. I operate under the assumption that it's not possible because I don't want to feel anxious or paranoid around my computer.
To indicate that the camera is on.
To let me know it's recording
To let you know if it is recording.
If its plugged in its entirely possible. When the webcam isn't then it wouldn't
I believe it is to let me know that the webcam is actively recording

I have not given much thought to this before but after all the questions on this survey, now I think it may be possible. Luckily, I have always been in the habit of closing my laptop when I'm not using it and I don't have a desktop computer.
Not sure. but i think it's possible.
It's always possible but hopefully no one has.
I am not sure. I havent come across any hacking news thru web cam. So i am not sure.
To tell if the webcam is on or off.
I don't really know what hackers can do and I haven't heard of anyone I know being spied on through the webcam.
It lights up when it is recording
To tell you when the webcam is on
I don't know if that's possible, but the thought is unnerving.
I believe it is to show that the webcam is currently active if the light is on.
I'm not sure how that stuff works, so I'm not sure if it's possible or not
Notify me that the webcam is active.
I would have to activate my camera for it to work on my end
To signify that it is on.
I use Linux. Not a popular target for hackers.
The light turns on to let you know the webcam is active
I am not sure. I don't know much about this subject.
To show that the webcam is on and functional, and in some cases for better lighting
Not sure because usually I have it disabled through a program and in my startup, the services for the webcam are disabled until I manually activate it
Haven't heard of this thing yet.
I would think it would be very difficult to gain access to my webcam. It would probably be possible, though.
It turns green when the webcam is actively recording and red when it's not.

I suppose anything is possible, although I feel most hackers go after "bigger fish" seems like that would be a lot of work for not a lot of payoff. I believe I have firewalls that would prevent that kind of thing, but I don't know if that works with webcams. So, I guess I'm not 100% sure either way.
It is probably possible, but i think it would be pretty difficult.
To let you know it is recording
Once my webcam is ready to be in use, the light would come on, if I am not using it, there is no light.
I dont really know how that works
I think it is possible, but I dont want to think about it!
I keep tape over my webcam to prevent this kind of thing.
At times it will appear briefly when I'm streaming video.
Lets you know the camera is on
There are two; one to show there is a connection, and another to show it is in use.
I'm not super knowledgeable about the current abilities of hackers.
It's so I can know where to look at.
It tells me when it's on
anything is possible now in this world
It's a security feature to show that the webcam is on and actively taking video.
i never use my spycam on my laptop,so i presume it is off.so if there is a way the hacker can turn it on then he can other wise the answer would be no
To indicate to you that the webcam is on.
to let me know if its recording
don't see a reason to, leave it off most times
I've never heard of that happening, but I can't think of any reason why it wouldn't be possible.
The light is to help illuminate the area that is being recorded by the webcam.
Chances may be there but these kind of people cannot show their face directly.
I do not know. I would guess it's to indicate the webcam is on?
I think my computer is pretty secure but you never know.
I don't know enough about how my webcam can be identified and accessed through the internet.
To tell me when the webcam is on.
I'm careful about what information I share while using my computer.
Like I said--I don't have it plugged in when I'm not using it, but I suppose it would be possible to hack it when I am using it...it wouldn't be very interesting, though.
It is to indicate that the webcam is currently recording.
Again, I didn't think they could do that with this webcam, but maybe they could?
To indicate if the webcam is on.
I'm not sure if that's something a hacker is capable of. I would have to research this.
To indicate that the webcam is currently in use
I don't know how it how it works, how common, or how to safeguard it.
I don't know how they hack my computer. I think may be my cam has an IP address.. with that they access my lap.
maybe possible, but unlikely since my laptop isn't running windows or mac
I started putting tape on the webcam since I read about recent news of hackers hacking webcams.
I am not get that much of knowledge
To indicate that Camera is on(working)
i try to not use my webcam for anything but Skype.
Tells you if the camera is on.
it is possible thru a virus but i am pretty careful and have antivirus protection so i would hope the possibility would be low for me
To show the webcam is recording or is sending data.
i dont know how they would but now I hope my webcam does have a light indicated usage
I'm not entirely sure but I assume it's to make it easier to see the subject
I dont know that anyone would want to spy on me.
to notify me when the webcam is active
Not sure exactly how it works, what pathways the computer goes through to work the webcam.
I have pretty tight security measures on my computer, but anything's possible, yeah?
To indicate when the webcam is on
I do not believe it would be very likely, however nothing is impossible.
I haven't used it much, but I don't think it is very vulnerable to hackers.
It tells me whether the camera is turned on or off.
I do not know what is necessary to hack into a computer. For instance, if this is an easy task, what skills are required and how many people possess these skills.
The light turns on when I am using the webcam.
I simply do not have that knowledge.
I think it is technically possible, but given the large network I am on, firewalls at several levels, and because my computer is not always on, it would seem unlikely.

I'm sure the technology exists but I don't think I've been susceptible to whatever programs a hacker would need to use in order to obtain remote access to my laptop. I run into malware/trojans/etc very infrequently.
I find it highly unlikely but I am sure that a hacker would be capable if I had downloaded a malicious file on my laptop.
To know if it is recording.
I know about email hackers and stealing credit card numbers, but webcam hacker is new to hear and I am very much shocked, I don't know whether it is possible or not. Is it true or not.
To let you know it's recording or on
I have a pretty good firewall, and antivirus program, but anything is possible.
To tell me if it is on
I think it's possible but I doubt there's many people that know how and I highly doubt they'd want to spy on me.
To show when the webcam is on.

I hope not, but I have no expertise in hacking, so I don't know what's possible. I generally assume that the world is full of danger and I can't live in fear of everything I don't understand, so I just do my best.
Light indicates when video is on.
not sure how possible it is.
to be able to view the person better
i think i have a good firewall but there could be vulnerabilities
The light indicates whether the webcam is currently activated and in use. It is off when it is not in use.
I keep my webcam cover closed if I am not using it, but it is possible that they could while I am actively using it. They could also record audio at any point.
to illuminate in dark environments or light to show its recording. don't know for sure
We have extreme protection and passwords for our system.
It indicates when the webcam is on.
I try to keep my computer secure and practice safe computing habits.
The light is to signal that the webcam is turned on and in use.
I would say because I do not recall seeing a light come on, but if someone could control my webcam they could also be able to turn a light off.
It would require internet access, and I don't have regular internet access at my house. It could be possible when I take my computer to public wifi.
I don't know, I assume the webcam is on.
The light is to tell if the camera is on.
My webcam has a little red light off to the side of it, not sure exactly what its for though. Maybe to tell me the webcam is active and activated
I guess I never really thought about it and now I'm really freaked out.
To know if the webcam is on.
I guess you never think it would be you in these kinds of situations.
to help provide better illumination of the subject near the lens. It also indicates the webcam is on
I always try and use my webcam to interact with family and friends whom I know well.
To indicate whether the webcam is activated and in use.
I am not aware about it.
To let you know when the webcam is powered on
I think with today's technology and the advancement of hackers anyone can be spied on no matter how secure they think their computer system is.
I don't know for sure but I think it is to illuminate the object in front of the webcam. My cam has 6 LED's, three on each side and they are very bright. They are always on!
I imagine a hacker could do just about anything on my pc if they were so inclined and I was vulnerable. This would include operating and viewing my webcam feed.
To indicate that the webcam is recording or taking a picture.
If the webcam was hacked and I didn't have the camera covered with a piece of tape when I'm not using it, I suppose it might be possible.
If they can get my webcam to turn on, they might be able to see me do things.
They can use any function of the computer once they hack it
It tells me when the camera is turned on.
I think they could remotely access my camera if they hacked my computer.
I guess hacker might turn on webcam and use it if he/she can remote use my laptop.
Hackers are capable of shutting down nuclear reactors in Iran, I assume that hackers can do virtually anything if they are so inclined.
to let me know when its on
I think they could hack into any part of my computer including the web cam if so motivated.
The light comes on when the cam is active, letting you know it's recording.
If software turns the webcam on, I suppose it's possible for a hacker to write software that does the same thing.
it indicates that camera is on
Hackers are pretty smart, I guess if they wanted to they could do it.
I feel like a hacker could potentially access my webcam if they hacked in through my network and could turn it on.
to indicate when the webcam's status
Hackers can do a lot, they can get into the FBI for goodness sake
The light on the webcam lets me know it's active.
Hackers are extremely smart and determined
It's an indicator showing whether the webcam is on or off.

webcam is external device and when connected to computer it a device which is control through software. if hacker can access the software then there is high chance he can use webcam without my knowledge
for indicating that the webcam has been turned on.
Remotely accessing my computer and operating its hardware should be no problem for some experienced hacker.
with technology advancing, anything is pretty much possible these days. Hackers are getting smarter and more creative in their methods of hacking on people's computers.
I really don't know, I would think it was intended maybe to shine light on the person using the webcam?
To indicate the webcam is on.
I've seen news reports about it
It is to let you know that the webcam is working.

It is possible. I have heard of this before and how hackers can get control of your computer and then use your webcam without the light on to watch you and what you are doing on your computer and in the room.
It means that it is on and recording
I remember a news story about a school that sent home laptops with webcams and used them to spy on kids.
I imagine it wouldn't be hard to do but I wonder if it's possible to do so without activating the light.
It lets me know that the camera in in use.
I'm sure they could but I don't know why they'd want to. I'm boring.
to indicate that the camera gets on
hackers can do anything and we've heard cases of people hacking webcams in the news
I've seen news reports of this happening
hackers and send attachments to me in emails and I would click them. Unknowingly, I would have downloaded a spyware that they can use to control my computer.
To indicate that the webcam is on.
I think anything is possible, you can only take so many security precautions
I think that hackers can attack my connection with the webcam and spy it.
I don't know, maybe to tell you when it is on
Hackers can do a lot more complicated things than turning on a webcam. I try to have good security but I know some people have unsecure webcams.
It lets you know when the webcam is being used, or is on.
With the right program, they could remotely control my computer and start the webcam software.
If i had one, it would be either a status light.
If they were really motivated to, sure. Wouldn't be the first person it's happened to.
It indicates that the camera is on.
i can remote access my computer from my phone, turn on my webcam, and view the things through it. So why couldn't somebody else?
To indicate that the webcam is online ie., ready for use and running.
because I know the technology exists to do it
I think people are very capable of doing this. I have read that it can be done without activating the light of the webcam.
Indicates whether the webcam is turned on or not
Yes, because I read that the FBI can turn on the webcam without people knowing that it is on.
It is to indicate that my webcam is on and working.
to show that the video is working
it tells you whether the webcam is powered on or not
If someone had the appropriate application they would be able to use it as I sometimes leave my laptop open when not in use.
to let you know the camera is on

I think the purpose of the blue light near the webcam is to let me know that the webcam is on and recording what I do. When the light is not on, the microphone can still work without the camera light being on.
I just recently read a news article about a young man that was arrested for spying on a college student through her webcam.
To indicate that the webcam is on.
It is to let me know it is working. I think it also helps illuminate the picture.
I think hackers are sophisticated enough to spy on people through their webcams.
The hackers are full of tricks
Hacker can access the webcam by hacking the computer and gaining the control.
It's a green light to let me know when the webcam is on.
I know it is possible for people to "take over" your computer, so I assume that would include the webcam as well.
The light is there to know when the webcam is on.
I think its probably not hard to spy to spy this way
Desktops on computers can be accessed remotely, I wouldn't be surprised if hackers could figure out how to do it without notifying the owner
I am sure it's possible. I don't know how it is possible, but if someone can remotely control a ccomputer, there is no reason that they can't spy,.
If the hacker was able to hack my computer, the hacker would be able to turn on my webcam.
Lets me know when it's working.
They can do whatebver they want with computers
To let me know that the webcam is on, possibly recording video.
I'm sure there has to be a way to turn off the light, and with the right malware I could imagine that this could happen.
tells me when the camera is on
I've heard of schools doing it.
To give you better light when in a dark place
It is possible, but it's doubtful they would choose me to spy on
I don't think I have one.
Because you can access computers through the IP.
It tells me when the webcam is on.
I am always on my computer
I'm not sure, mine does not have a light near it.
I've read about it happening before which is why I am careful to keep my laptop closed and tape over webcams
To know if the camera is on
If they can get software on my PC then they could enable anything on it, including the webcam.
To show if the cam is in use/recording
Hackers *can* take 100% control over computers, VPN-style. Doesn't mean they all do, or all can, but it is completely possible.
They access it from a different place.
It's always possible, I just don't think it's likely.
The light next to the webcam is to let you know it is in use.
Technology is rapidly increasing, and that always comes with many risks. Hackers can already take control of your computer so I'd assume they can take control of your webcam, too.
I don't know. I would think it would be to shine on you when you use it to make it more clearer.
I think it would be, but I don't know why they would want to.
To show that it is active
With the advancement in technology and increase in the number of bad people in the world
to show when it is on.
He may on my cam and watch what i am doing currently or when ever i use system.
I think it is used for taking better picture and video.
I think if a hacker can remotely access your computer, he or she can very well have control and function of the webcam.
To indicate that it is on
I am sure they could remotely login and see what I am doing if they really wanted to

This is something that I have often wondered, if they can hack into your computer, maybe there is a chance that they can hack your webcam and see what you are doing. Maybe the light would go off, maybe not, very scary!

It's entirely possible but it would take them a lot of work and for not much gain. I don't break the law and they would have to get through privoxy and Avira to access my computer remotely which wouldn't be easy, though not impossible by any means. If I was a politician I may be more worried.
The webcam light comes on whenever the webcam is in use (whenever it is recording, so to speak)

I have programmed an application to record audio from my webcam using a web application. I'm sure that someone malicious enough can trick me to execute a similar javascript app through a link, or force it into my home network.
It's just another interface of a computer.
tell you its working and on
They could find a way to remote access my desktop if they found a way to get access to my computer.
I'm sure if somebody really wanted to they would have no trouble breaching my security measures.
To provide the necessary lighting to an image they way a camera flashes when taking a picture.

I think there is always a possibility, even if it was really rare. I have heard stories of people's computers being hacked and the hacker using the webcam to spy on them. I'd like to think that it isn't very likely though.
It would probably be pretty easy to install an applet that opens the webcam application.
I think it is a indicator light to show that it is on.

I don't know much about hacking, but I believe it possible, I just don't know if the camera can be activated without the light coming on as well, therefore the hacked individual would know they were being watched.
The purpose of the light near the webcam is to indicate that it is on and ready to use.
anything is possible if a hacker has remote access to your computer.
To notify the user when the camera is in use
If my computer was not protected to internet attacks, it is definitely possible.
The purpose of the light is to indicate whether or not the camera is active.
I believe they could remotely access the webcam without turning on the light so I was unaware.
The light turns on when the webcam is active and recording video.
Because i saw it on criminal minds.
The light is on when the webcam is on
If someone got remote access to my desktop, they could easily turn the webcam on.
To let you know that it's functioning, that essentially "Your on".
Yes, I have heard of it happening before so I definitely think it is possible.
The purpose of the light is to let you know the webcam is on.
I know that it is possible to hack web cams so I wouldn't be surprised. I'm not female or rich though so I am not worried about this.
I'm sure my computer's security is not very good like most people. Hackers are smart to figure out most security systems.
To let the user know that the camera is on and recording or transmitting video
I know that hackers actually can do this because I've read of people who have gotten hacked in this way.
To tell me when the camera is on and being used, so that I can make sure I didn't leave it on and let people see things that I don't want them to see.
I think it's possible with the tech available today.
Every day spyware is increasing there is chance to spy the person through the webcam.once we authentication webcam start to work spyware does not allow the LED to glow.
My webcam does not have a light

I have heard stories before of people activating webcams remotely and taking pictures of other people. I am under the assumption that this is less likely because I use Ubuntu rather than windows, but I do not have the expertise to know this for sure.
Tells you when the thing is being actively used.
Anything is possible so long as you are connected to the internet and have everything plugged in. Its probably hard to do but not impossible.
The purpose of the light is to let you know if the camera is currently active.
It is supposed to tell me when the camera is on and in use. I presume it is off when the light is not on.

i think it is possible, but not likely at all since the hacker would have to be actively checking each computer to see if there is a webcam, and then monitor said webcam to see what's going on. plus it is a dead give away for the user to know if there's a hacker in the system. I don't think that a hacker would want to let it be known that he's hacked the system by foolishly turning on the webcam and letting the other person know that they're being watched.
to make sure it is working.
If they gained access to my computer then I think it would be possible to turn my webcam on and remoting use the webcam.
I don't know for sure but I believe it indicates when the camera is actively capturing.

I'm sure if they could somehow access my computer, they'd be able to open the Webcam software. They may even be able to modify the process that tells the white LED to switch on, so they could watch me without me noticing.
It would be possibly through remote access.
If someone has remote access to my webcam it is entirely possible for them to spy on me through it. The only way for a hacker to do this though is if had malware/viruses on my computer.
i think that light when on my webcam appear light
its possible for the expert hackers
The FBI can spy on you WITHOUT the light coming on. Anyone that knows how, can. With or without the light.
I guess anything is possible concerning the internet, I dont have much of an expectation of privacy when it comes to computers.
To let you know the webcam is working.
I've heard of it happening before
For indicating that the camera is working.
It's on the internet, I think it could happen.
Anything is possible. But, I only visit reputable sights and using a Mac helps cut down on hacking attempts.
To signify the camera is being used. collecting image/video
A webcam is a resource that any program can theoretically be allowed to access. Some form of malware that a hacker is using would be no different.
i've never thought about it but if they can get access to my computer they can obviously turn on the webcam. scary.

If they were somehow able to disable the blue light by my webcam, my webcam could be recording my video without my knowledge. (Then again, with my 256 kbps internet I would definitely notice the drop in browsing speed due to video use)
when the computer is booting up the light comes on and when its finished loading it goes off.
